0.4319393.15066992.html.plaintext.txt	235	1 The abbreviations used are: ER, endoplasmic reticulum; ERAD, ER-associated degradation; CFTR, cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator; RT, reverse transcriptase; GAPDH, glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase; ALLN, N-acetyl-leucyl-leucyl-norleucinal; MDCK, Madin-Darby canine kidney.
0.4319393.15066992.html.plaintext.txt	236	   ACKNOWLEDGMENTS   We thank the Gregory Fleming James CF Research Center for their support of this research.
0.4319393.15066992.html.plaintext.txt	237	 Elizabeth Sztul and Erik Schwiebert for critical reading of the manuscript and for their helpful suggestions.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	0	 1995 by The American Society for Biochemistry and Molecular Biology, Inc.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	1	 Intracellular Loop between Transmembrane Segments IV and V of Cystic Fibrosis Transmembrane Conductance Regulator Is Involved in Regulation of Chloride Channel Conductance State (*).
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	2	(Received for publication, August 1, 1995; and in revised form, September 21, 1995).
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	3	 Drumm (2),  Jianjie Ma (1),  Pamela B.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	4	The cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator (CFTR) contains two membrane-spanning domains; each consists of six transmembrane segments joined by three extracellular and two intracellular loops of different length.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	5	 To examine the role of intracellular loops in CFTR channel function, we studied a deletion mutant of CFTR (19 CFTR) in which 19 amino acids were removed from the intracellular loop joining transmembrane segments IV and V.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	6	 This mutant protein was expressed in a human embryonic kidney cell line (293 HEK).
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	7	 Fully mature glycosylated CFTR (170 kDa) was immunoprecipitated from cells transfected with wild-type CFTR cDNA, while cells transfected with the mutant gene expressed only a core-glycosylated form (140 kDa).
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	8	 The chloride efflux rate (measured by 6-methoxyl-N-(3-sulfopropyl) quinolinium SPQ fluorescence) from cells expressing wild-type CFTR increased 600% in response to forskolin.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	9	 In contrast, 19 CFTR-expressing cells had no significant response to forskolin.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	10	 Western blotting performed on subcellular membrane fractions showed that 19 CFTR was located in the same fractions as F508 CFTR, a processing mutant of CFTR.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	11	 These results suggest that 19 CFTR is located in the intracellular membranes, without reaching the cell surface.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	12	 Upon reconstitution into lipid bilayer membranes, 19 CFTR formed a functional Cl channel with gating properties nearly identical to those of the wild-type CFTR channel.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	13	 However, 19 CFTR channels exhibited frequent transitions to a 6-picosiemens subconductance state, whereas wild-type CFTR channels rarely exist in this subconductance state.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	14	 These data suggest that the intracellular loop is involved in stabilizing the full conductance state of the CFTR Cl channel.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	15	The cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator (CFTR) ()consists of five distinct regions, with two putative membrane-spanning domains, two nucleotide-binding folds, and a regulatory domain(1) .
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	16	 CFTR forms a Cl channel of linear conductance(2, 3) , which is regulated by cAMP-dependent protein kinase phosphorylation (2, 4, 5, 6) at multiple sites in the regulatory domain and by binding and hydrolysis of ATP by the nucleotide-binding folds (7, 8, 9, 10) .
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	17	 The structure and function of these five domains of CFTR have been extensively studied(11, 12, 13, 14) .
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	18	 In contrast, little is known about the role of intracellular loops and their contribution to the function of the CFTR Cl channel.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	19	The intracellular loops of other channel proteins appear to participate in channel function.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	20	 For instance, mutations in the second intracellular loop of the Shaker K channel affect channel inactivation(15) .
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	21	 Deletion of a portion of the putative cytosolic loops between two transmembrane repeats of the Na channel slows the rate of channel inactivation(16) .
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	22	 To investigate the role of the intracellular loops of CFTR in Cl channel function, we studied a deletion mutant of CFTR (19 CFTR) in which 19 amino acids were removed from the intracellular loop joining transmembrane segments IV and V in the first membrane-spanning domain.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	23	 This is the largest and most hydrophilic loop in the first membrane-spanning domain, as one-third of the residues in this loop are charged.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	24	 These features make this loop a candidate for electrostatic or allosteric interactions with other cytosolic domains of CFTR (nucleotide-binding folds, the regulatory domain, or other intracellular loops) and cellular proteins to contribute to channel function.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	25	Subcloning of CFTR GeneThe wild-type and F508 CFTR cDNAs (17) were subcloned into an Epstein-Barr virus-based episomal eukaryotic expression vector, pCEP4 (Invitrogen, San Diego, CA), between the NheI and XhoI restriction sites.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	26	 The mutant gene, which lacks 57 nucleotides between nucleotides 930 and 987, was shuttled from pBluescript into pCEP4 by substituting the corresponding fragment in pCEP4(WT) (where WT is wild type) with the mutant one between the KpnI and AflII restriction sites.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	27	 The mutant clone (pCEP4(19)) was confirmed by restriction enzyme digestion and DNA sequencing of the shuttled fragment from nucleotides 874 to 1040.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	28	Cell CultureA human embryonic kidney cell line (293-EBNA, Invitrogen) was used for transfection and expression of wild-type and mutant CFTR proteins.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	29	 This cell line contains a pCMV-EBNA vector, which constitutively expresses the Epstein-Barr virus EBNA-1 gene product and increases the transfection efficiency of Epstein-Barr virus-based vectors.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	30	 The cell line exhibited high transfection efficiency (up to 80%) with Lipofectin reagent (Life Technologies, Inc.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	31	) following the manufacturer's instructions.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	32	 The cells were maintained in Dulbecco's modified Eagle's medium (Biofluids, Inc.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	33	, Rockville, MD) containing 10% fetal bovine serum (Life Technologies, Inc.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	34	 Geneticin (G418 sulfate, 250  microg/ml; Life Technologies, Inc.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	35	) was added to cell culture medium for the continuous selection of cells containing the pCMV-EBNA vector.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	36	 The parent cell line was grown to confluence in a 37  degrees C incubator with 5% CO and passed 1:5 2 days before the gene transfer.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	37	 pCEP4(WT), pCEP4(F508), or pCEP4(19) was then introduced into the cells, using Lipofectin reagent.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	38	 Two days after transfection, the cells were passed and selected for hygromycin resistance in medium containing hygromycin B (Boehringer, Mannheim, Germany) at 260  microg/ml.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	39	 After 3 weeks in selection, the cells were used for immunoprecipitation and Western blot assay, SPQ assay, isolation of microsomal vesicles, and reconstitution studies in lipid bilayers.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	40	Immunoprecipitation/Western Blot Assay of CFTR293 HEK cells transfected with pCEP4(WT), pCEP4(/delta]F508), or pCEP4(19) were cultured to confluence in 162-cm flasks (Costar, Cambridge, MA).
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	41	 Cells were washed three times with ice-cold phosphate-buffered saline (137 mM NaCl, 10 mM NaHPO, 2.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	42	8 mM KHPO, 5  microM diisopropyl fluorophosphate, pH 7.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	43	4), lysed with 1 ml of ice-cold radioimmune precipitation assay solution (150 mM NaCl, 50 mM Tris-Cl, pH 8.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	44	0, 1% Triton X-100, 1% sodium deoxycholate, 0.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	45	1% SDS) in the presence of protease inhibitors (10  microg/ml aprotinin, 10  microg/ml pepstatin A, and 5  microM diisopropyl fluorophosphate), and spun at 48,000 g for 1 h at 4  degrees C.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	46	 A mouse anti-human CFTR monoclonal antibody that is specific for the regulatory domain of CFTR (monoclonal antibody 13-1, 2  microg; Genzyme Corp.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	47	, Cambridge, MA) was added to 350  microl of the above cell lysis supernatant solution and incubated on ice for 90 min.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	48	 Antibody complexes were then precipitated with 20  microl of protein G-agarose beads (Boehringer) by incubation at 4  degrees C for 30 min on a rocker.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	49	 The beads were washed with radioimmune precipitation assay solution three times, and the bound proteins were solubilized with 20  microl of gel sample buffer (200 mM Tris-Cl, pH 6.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	50	7, 9% SDS, 6% -mercaptoethanol, 15% glycerol, 0.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	51	01% bromphenol blue) and loaded onto a 5% SDS-polyacrylamide gel.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	52	 The proteins were then transferred to a polyvinylidene difluoride membrane (Bio-Rad) and probed with monoclonal antibody 13-1 (0.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	53	 A secondary peroxidase-conjugated affinity-purified goat antibody to mouse IgG (Organon Teknika Corp.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	54	, West Chester, PA) was added to allow visualization of the CFTR-antibody complex.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	55	 The proteins were detected by chemiluminescence according to the manufacturer's recommendations (ECL kit, Amersham Corp.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	56	SPQ Assay of Cl TransportCells were transferred to glass coverslips, cultured for 2-3 days, and then loaded with SPQ fluorescent dye by hypotonic loading as described previously(18) .
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	57	 Briefly, cells were incubated at room temperature for 4 min with a 1:1 mixture of Cl buffer (126 mM NaCl, 5 mM KCl, 1.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	58	2) and distilled HO containing 5 mM SPQ.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	59	 The glass coverslip was mounted in a chamber on a stage heated to 37  degrees C, which was arranged for continuous flow of warmed buffer solutions and studied one-by-one using an upright Zeiss epifluorescence microscope.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	60	 Fluorescence was excited at 355 nm (Omega Optical Inc.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	61	, Brattleboro, VT) by a 75-watt xenon lamp.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	62	 Excitation light was reflected by a 400-nm fused silica dichroic mirror (Omega Optical Inc.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	63	) and illuminated the cells through a 20 objective (numerical aperature of 0.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	64	 Emitted light was filtered by a 450-nm lens and detected by a microchannel plate image intensifier (Model KS-1381) in series with a CCD-200 solid-state video camera (Video Scope International, Ltd.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	65	 The images were quantified with a Model MVP-AT frame grabber board (Matrox, Quebec, Canada) mounted internally in a host 386 computer and processed with Image-1 Fl software (Universal Imaging Corp.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	66	26 s) represents the average of 16 images.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	67	 Successive images were recorded at a rate of 1 every 5 s.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	68	 The ``blank field'' obtained by closing the camera shutter was used as background image and subtracted prior to acquisition of the images.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	69	 SPQ fluorescence was calibrated by measuring the fluorescence in the absence of chloride (maximum fluorescence) and in the presence of a solution that quenched all the SPQ fluorescence (150 mM KSCN, 10  microM valinomycin).
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	70	 Photobleaching was corrected by subtracting a straight line that connects the two points at the beginning of the experiment and before KSCN + valinomycin application.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	71	 Results are expressed as rates (relative fluorescence units/minute).
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	72	 The rates were calculated by fitting a single exponential equation to the initial portion of each single curve after correction for photobleaching.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	73	 Cells that exhibited  > 15% photobleaching or dye leakage were not used for analysis.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	74	Subcellular Fractionation of Membrane VesiclesThe protocol used was a modified version of that of Gunderson and Kopito (19) (see Fig.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	75	 Briefly, 12 75-cm flasks of 293 HEK cells transfected with the pCEP4(WT), pCEP4(F508), or pCEP4(19) vector were harvested by scraping from the flask bottom following three washes with ice-cold phosphate-buffered saline.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	76	 The cell pellet (600 g, 5 min, 4  degrees C) was then resuspended by incubation for 10 min in ice-cold hypotonic lysis buffer (10 mM Hepes, pH 7.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	77	2, 1 mM EDTA, 5  microM diisopropyl fluorophosphate, 10  microg/ml pepstatin A, 10  microg/ml aprotinin, 9.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	78	6 mg/ml benzamidine) prior to lysis by 10 strokes in tight-fitting Dounce homogenizer, followed by 15 strokes after addition of an equal volume of sucrose buffer (500 mM sucrose, 1 mM EDTA, 10 mM Hepes, pH 7.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	79	 Microsomes were collected by centrifugation of the post-mitochondrial supernatant (6000 g, 20 min, 4  degrees C) at 100,000 g for 45 min and resuspended with either 600  microl of isotonic buffer (250 mM sucrose, 1 mM EDTA, 10 mM Hepes, pH 7.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	80	2) or prephosphorylation buffer (250 mM sucrose, 10 mM Hepes, pH 7.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	81	2, 5 mM ATP, 5 mM MgCl, 100 units/ml cAMP-dependent protein kinase catalytic subunit).
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	82	 Further separation of plasma and intracellular membranes was carried out in a discontinuous sucrose gradient (10,000 g, 6 h, 4  degrees C) in a swinging bucket rotor (SW 28).
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	83	 Each fraction (I-V) was collected at the interface of the two sucrose gradients.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	84	 Subsequently, an abbreviated fractionation scheme was used that separated F508 CFTR from the wild type and ``intracellular membrane'' from ``plasma membrane.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	85	'' In this experiment, cells were washed and lysed in buffer as before, except that diisopropyl fluorophosphate was not included.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	86	 The post-mitochondrial supernatant was spun at 12,000 g for 30 min to give intracellular membrane (Fig.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	87	 5C, IM), and the supernatant was spun at 100,000 g for 45 min to give plasma membrane (PM).
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	88	Figure 5: Subcellular fractionation and Western blotting of CFTR.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	89	 A, a discontinuous sucrose gradient with five densities (28, 33, 36, 38.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	90	7%) was used to separate the plasma membrane from intracellular membranes.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	91	 B, shown is the top of the gradient (lane I), 28/33% (lane II), 33/36% (lane III), 36/38.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	92	7% (lane V), and pellet (lane VI).
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	93	 50  microg of total protein from each fraction were subjected to 5% SDS-polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis; the CFTR protein was detected as described under ``Experimental Procedures.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	94	'' Protein markers are labeled in the middle.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	95	 C, plasma (PM) and intracellular membrane (IM) fractions of F508 CFTR- and 19 CFTR-expressing cells grown at 37  degrees C were run on a 5% SDS-polyacrylamide gel and detected as described for B.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	96	 Protein markers are labeled on the left.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	97	 Arrowhead a, wild-type (WT) CFTR protein (170 kDa); arrowhead b, F508 CFTR protein (140 kDa); arrowhead c, 19 CFTR protein (140 kDa).
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	98	Detection of CFTR by Western BlottingThe membrane fractions collected from the above procedure were washed and resuspended in isotonic buffer.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	99	 50  microg of protein from each fraction were denatured with 6 gel sample buffer (300 mM Tris-Cl, pH 6.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	100	8, 600 mM dithiothreitol, 12% SDS, 0.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	101	6% bromphenol blue) and loaded onto a 5% SDS-polyacrylamide gel.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	102	 The proteins were then transferred to a polyvinylidene difluoride membrane and detected as described under ``Immunoprecipitation/Western Blot Assay of CFTR.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	103	Reconstitution of CFTR Cl ChannelLipid bilayer membranes were formed across an aperture of 200- microm diameter with a lipid mixture of phosphatidylethanolamine/phosphatidylserine/cholesterol at a ratio of 6:6:1; the lipids are dissolved in decane at a concentration of 40 mg/ml(20) .
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	104	 The recording solutions contained the following: cis-side solution (intracellular), 200 mM KCl, 2 mM MgATP, and 10 mM Hepes/Tris, pH 7.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	105	4; and trans-side solution (extracellular), 50 mM KCl, 10 mM Hepes/Tris, pH 7.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	106	 Microsomal vesicles (3-6  microl) containing the wild-type or 19 CFTR protein were added to the cis-side solution.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	107	 50 units/ml cAMP-dependent protein kinase catalytic subunit (Promega, Madison, WI) was always present in the cis-side solution.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	108	 Single channel currents were recorded with an Axopatch 200A patch clamp unit (Axon Instruments, Inc.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	109	 Data acquisition and pulse generation were performed with a 486 computer and a 1200 Digidata A/D-D/A convertor (Axon Instruments, Inc.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	110	 The currents were sampled at 1-2.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	111	5 ms/point and filtered at 100 Hz.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	112	 Single channel data analyses were performed with pClamp software (Axon Instruments, Inc.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	113	Subcloning of CFTR Mutant Gene into Eukaryotic Expression VectorThe CFTR mutant studied in this paper was a spontaneous deletion mutation in the CFTR cDNA in which 57 nucleotides corresponding to 19 amino acids (MIENIQSVKAYCWEEAMEK, residues 266-284) were deleted.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	114	 These residues are located in the intracellular loop joining transmembrane segments IV and V in the first membrane-spanning domain (Fig.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	115	 The mutant gene was shuttled from pBluescript into pCEP4 for eukaryotic cell expression.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	116	 The pCEP4 vector contains the cytomegalovirus promoter, which drives the transcription of the cloned gene.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	117	Figure 1: Predicted topology of CFTR.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	118	 The predicted membrane topology of CFTR is shown, with the deleted 19 amino acids indicated.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	119	 L, loop; TM, transmembrane segment; NBF, nucleotide-binding fold; R, regulatory.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	120	Expression of Wild-type and Mutant CFTR ProteinsThe CFTR protein was expressed in the eukaryotic cells by transfecting pCEP4(WT), pCEP4(F508), or pCEP4(19) into 293 HEK cells using the Lipofectin reagent(21) .
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	121	 To confirm CFTR expression, the immunoprecipitation/Western blot assay was performed on the transfected cells.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	122	 Cells transfected with pCEP4(WT) expressed a readily detectable amount of a fully glycosylated form of the CFTR protein with a molecular mass of 170 kDa, while the untransfected cells did not (Fig.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	123	 Cells transfected with either pCEP4(F508) or pCEP4(19) showed a dominant band at 140 kDa (Fig.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	124	 2), which probably corresponds to the core-glycosylated form of CFTR.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	125	 Consistent with other studies(22, 23) , F508 CFTR, which is incompletely glycosylated at 37  degrees C, displayed increased glycosylation when the culture temperature was lowered to 26  degrees C (Fig.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	126	 However, incubation of pCEP4(19)-transfected cells at 26  degrees C for 2 days did not increase the amount of 19 CFTR protein in the fully glycosylated form (Fig.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	127	 The amount of 140-kDa protein associated with both F508 CFTR and 19 CFTR increased significantly following the lower temperature incubation (Fig.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	128	 2, lanes 5 and 7), probably due to the slower degradation of the abnormal protein in the intracellular organelles.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	129	Figure 2: Immunoprecipitation and Western blotting of CFTR.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	130	 293 HEK cells transfected with pCEP4(WT), pCEP4(F508), or pCEP4(19) were immunoprecipitated and blotted as described under ``Experimental Procedures.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	131	'' A similar number of cells were lysed for each cell line.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	132	 The proteins were visualized by exposing the blot to a Kodak X-Omat AR film for 3 min.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	133	 Lane 1, untransfected 293 HEK cells; lanes 2 and 3, wild-type CFTR-expressing cells; lanes 4 and 5, F508 CFTR-expressing cells; lanes 6 and 7, 19 CFTR-expressing cells.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	134	 Lanes labeled 26  degrees C contained cells cultured to 8090% confluence at 37  degrees C (5% CO), followed by incubation at 26  degrees C (6% CO) for 2 days.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	135	SPQ Assay of Cl TransportThe immunoprecipitation/Western blot assay detected no fully glycosylated 19 CFTR protein.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	136	 However, other studies have shown that some CFTR mutants produce the fully glycosylated form in quantities too small to be detected by the above assay, but can nevertheless result in functional channels at the cell surface(23, 24) .
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	137	 To test the surface function of 19 CFTR, the SPQ assay was performed on pCEP4(19)-transfected cells using pCEP4(WT)-transfected cells as a positive control and untransfected cells as a negative control.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	138	 Representative traces of chloride movement for five to six cells of each cell line in the absence and presence of 10  microM forskolin are depicted in Fig.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	139	 A decrease in SPQ fluorescence indicates Cl influx, and an increase in fluorescence indicates Cl efflux.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	140	 Forskolin failed to elicit an increase in the rate of Cl efflux in untransfected 293 HEK cells (Fig.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	141	 Wild-type CFTR-transfected cells, on the other hand, exhibited a significant increase in the rate of Cl efflux upon forskolin stimulation (Fig.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	142	 In cells transfected with 19 CFTR, stimulation of the rate of Cl efflux by forskolin was not statistically different from that of untransfected cells (Fig.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	143	 Data from multiple experiments are summarized in Fig.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	144	 Incubation of the 19 CFTR-expressing cells at 26  degrees C for 15-48 h did not increase the rate of Cl efflux following forskolin stimulation (Fig.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	145	 This result is consistent with the immunoprecipitation/Western blot studies (Fig.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	146	 2), which indicate that little or no 19 CFTR reaches the Golgi apparatus for final glycosylation and presumably does not transport to the plasma membrane.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	147	Figure 3: SPQ assay of Cl transport.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	148	 Cells loaded with SPQ were preincubated with nitrate solution (126 mM NaNO, 5 mM KNO, 1.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	149	2) on ice for 15 min to allow the depletion of intracellular chloride.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	150	 At the beginning of the experiment, the cells were first perfused with nitrate solution until the fluorescence was stable (1 min).
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	151	 Perfusion solution was then switched to Cl-containing solution.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	152	 SPQ fluorescence was quenched as Cl entered the cell.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	153	 When fluorescence reached its steady state, perfusion was switched to nitrate solution until the fluorescence came back to its base line.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	154	 This cycle was repeated with 10  microM forskolin (FSK) added to the Cl and nitrate solution.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	155	 At the conclusion of the experiment, cells were perfused with KSCN (150 mM) plus valinomycin (VAL; 10  microM) solution to quench all the fluorescence.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	156	 Each trace represents the fluorescence of a single cell from the beginning to the end.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	157	 A, untransfected 293 HEK cells; B, wild-type (WT) CFTR-transfected cells; C, 19 CFTR-transfected cells.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	158	 Fluorescence of five to six cells was plotted for each of the above three cases.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	159	Figure 4: Forskolin stimulation of the rate of Cl efflux.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	160	 The Cl efflux rate was calculated as described under ``Experimental Procedures'' and is plotted as the relative fluorescence units/minute (A).
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	161	 Open bars indicate the rate of basal Cl efflux; hatched bars indicate the rate of Cl efflux upon forskolin (FSK; 10  microM) stimulation.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	162	 The percentage of forskolin-stimulated Cl efflux over basal Cl efflux is also plotted (B).
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	163	 The untransfected cells (Control) have a forskolin-stimulated efflux rate of 157  plus or minus  7% of the base line (198 cells at 37  degrees C, n = 7).
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	164	 The wild-type (WT) CFTR-transfected cells have a forskolin-stimulated efflux rate of 618  plus or minus  37% of the base line (297 cells at 37  degrees C, n = 8).
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	165	 The 19 CFTR-expressing cells have a forskolin-stimulated efflux rate of 178  plus or minus  15% of the base line (170 cells at 37  degrees C, n = 10), which is not statistically different from the control.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	166	 Data labeled with 26  degrees C (wild-type CFTR: 453  plus or minus  144% forskolin stimulation, 40 cells, n = 3; 19 CFTR: 90  plus or minus  10% forskolin stimulation, 65 cells, n = 4) were obtained from cells incubated at 26  degrees C for 15-48 h before the experiment.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	167	Localization of 19 CFTR ProteinSubcellular membrane fractionation was performed with 293 HEK cells transfected with CFTR cDNA to localize the 19 CFTR protein.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	168	 Intracellular membranes were separated from the plasma membrane using a discontinuous sucrose density gradient (Fig.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	169	 Wild-type CFTR was used as a marker for the plasma membrane, and F508 CFTR, a known CFTR processing mutant, as a marker for the intracellular membranes.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	170	 Western blotting showed that the wild-type CFTR protein (170 kDa) was detected mainly in fractions II and III, while the F508 CFTR protein (140 kDa) was detected mainly in fraction IV of the sucrose density gradient (Fig.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	171	 Intracellular membrane fractions isolated from 19 CFTR-expressing cells contained a 140-kDa CFTR protein, which colocalized with the F508 CFTR protein (Fig.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	172	 Together with the immunoprecipitation/Western blot and SPQ assays, these data suggest that 19 CFTR is a processing mutant.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	173	Functional Characterization of Wild-type and 19 CFTR Cl ChannelsTo further study the function of 19 CFTR, microsomal vesicles, which contain mixtures of plasma membrane, endoplasmic reticulum, and Golgi membranes, were incorporated into planar lipid bilayers.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	174	 Its function was compared with that of wild-type CFTR, incorporated into planar lipid bilayers from plasma membrane vesicles.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	175	 Consistent with previous studies(19) , wild-type CFTR showed a cAMP-dependent protein kinase phosphorylation-dependent Cl channel with linear conductance of 8.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	176	 The extrapolated reversal potential was +22.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	177	4 mV in a KCl gradient of 200 mM (cis) and 50 mM (trans), consistent with a chloride-selective channel.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	178	 Without cAMP-dependent protein kinase, this 8-pS Cl channel was never observed in vesicles isolated from 293 HEK cells with (n  >  30) or without (n  >  20) transfection with CFTR cDNA.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	179	Figure 6: Reconstitution of CFTR Cl channel in lipid bilayer membranes.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	180	 Represented traces are selected single channel currents at the given test potential from a wild-type CFTR channel (A) and a 19 CFTR channel (B).
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	181	 Both wild-type and 19 CFTR channels exhibited a linear current-voltage relationship with a slope conductance of 8.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	182	6 pS and an extrapolated reversal potential of +22.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	183	 , wild-type CFTR (n = 76); , 19 CFTR (n = 14).
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	184	The reconstituted CFTR channels had slow kinetics of gating.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	185	 The open lifetime histogram contained at least two exponentials, with mean open lifetimes of = 23.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	186	 The relative occurrence of was y/(y + y) = 0.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	187	 An average open probability (p) of 0.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	188	 In separate studies, we found that the wild-type CFTR channel contained two distinct subconductance states with conductances of 6 pS (O2) and 2.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	189	7 pS, in addition to the full conductance state (8 pS, O1).
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	190	 ()The occurrence of O2, however, was low for wild-type CFTR and accounted for  < 10% of the open events (see Fig.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	191	Figure 7: Open time histograms at -80 mV.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	192	 Open events were calculated at -80 mV with wild-type (WT; A) and 19 (B) CFTR channels.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	193	 The histograms were constructed with a total of 4040 open events obtained in three separate experiments for wild-type CFTR and of 4843 open events obtained in four separate experiments for 19 CFTR.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	194	 The solid lines represent the best fit according to the following equation: y = y/ exp(-t/) + y/ exp(-t/), where = 23.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	195	Figure 10: Open current histogram at -80 mV.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	196	 The current amplitudes of the individual open events were calculated with the 50% threshold detection method using the pClamp software.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	197	 The currents were sorted at a resolution of 0.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	198	 The histogram in A contained three separate experiments with the wild-type (WT) CFTR channel, and that in B contained four separate experiments with the 19 CFTR channel.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	199	 The solid lines represent the best fit with the sum of two gaussian distribution functions: y = W/(&cjs3484;(2)) exp(-(x -  micro)/) + W/(&cjs3484;(2)) exp(-(x -  micro)/), where W = 5.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	200	When 19 CFTR was incorporated into the lipid bilayer membrane, functional Cl channel activity was identified.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	201	 The full conductance state (O1) of the 19 CFTR Cl channel was identical to that of the wild-type CFTR channel (Fig.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	202	 Similar to the wild-type CFTR channel, the 19 CFTR channel had an average open probability of 0.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	203	043 and mean open lifetimes of = 30.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	204	 The relative occurrence of was y/(y + y) = 0.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	205	 Thus, gating of the 19 CFTR channel is not significantly different from that of the wild-type CFTR channel at a time resolution of 100-Hz cutoff frequency in the bilayer system.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	206	Figure 8: Subconductance states of 19 CFTR.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	207	 Consecutive traces for wild-type (WT) CFTR and 19 CFTR were measured at a test potential of -80 mV.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	208	 In both cases, the bilayer contained three active CFTR channels.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	209	 O1 corresponds to the full open state (8 pS), and O2 corresponds to the subconductance state of the channel (6 pS).
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	210	A significant difference between 19 CFTR and wild-type CFTR was found in the distribution of channel subconductance states.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	211	 Unlike the wild-type CFTR channel, the 19 CFTR channel displayed a prominent subconductance state (O2; Fig.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	212	 9shows the amplitude histogram of two separate experiments with the wild-type and 19 CFTR channels.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	213	 The histograms were different from each other, particularly in the first open level.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	214	 The frequent occurrence of subconductance state resulted in an asymmetric distribution of the first open level of the 19 CFTR channel (indicated by O1 and O2).
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	215	 Similar phenomena were observed in 13 other experiments with 19 CFTR channels.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	216	 There was a relative paucity of instances of two channels in these recordings, especially for the 19 mutant, in records in which two channels are clearly present (e.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	217	 The reasons for this are unclear, and detailed analysis is beyond the scope of this paper.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	218	Figure 9: Amplitude histogram of CFTR channel.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	219	 Each histogram was constructed with 16 episodes of data shown in Fig.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	220	 All acquisition points were included.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	221	 The three open levels of wild-type (WT) CFTR could be fitted by gaussian distributions (first open level amplitude of -0.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	222	 The first open level of the 19 CFTR channels could be fitted by two gaussian distribution functions with amplitudes of -0.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	223	 10shows the amplitude histograms of open channel current pooled from multiple experiments in which a single CFTR channel was incorporated into the bilayer membrane.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	224	 Clearly, the 19 CFTR channel contained more openings to the O2 state than the wild-type CFTR channel (Fig.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	225	 The histograms could be fitted with the sum of two gaussian distribution functions, with mean currents of -0.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	226	 The relative occurrence of the O2 state was estimated at 9% for the wild-type CFTR channel and at 23% for the 19 CFTR channel.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	227	In this study, we examined the function of a CFTR deletion mutant, 19 CFTR.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	228	 This deletion mutation results in incomplete glycosylation and intracellular retention of CFTR based on the following observations.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	229	 (i) An immunoprecipitation/Western blot assay identified a core-glycosylated form of 19 CFTR (140 kDa), different from the fully mature glycosylated protein (170 kDa); (ii) subcellular fractionation showed the 19 CFTR protein localized predominantly in the intracellular membranes; and (iii) an SPQ assay of cells expressing 19 CFTR showed no forskolin-stimulated Cl transport.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	230	 However, this processing mutant maintained functional Cl channel activity, presumably in the intracellular organelles, when reconstituted into lipid bilayer membranes.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	231	 The most notable difference between wild-type and 19 CFTR channels lies in the distribution of conductance states.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	232	 The deletion mutation caused frequent occurrence of a subconductance state within the Cl channel.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	233	The most common disease-causing mutation of CFTR is the deletion of a single phenylalanine residue at position 508 (F508 CFTR).
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	234	 Most of the F508 CFTR protein is retained in the endoplasmic reticulum and fails to reach its intended site of action in the plasma membrane.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	235	 With regard to processing at 37  degrees C, 19 CFTR appears to be similar to F508 CFTR.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	236	 However, F508 CFTR appears in the fully mature glycosylated form and can traffic to the plasma membrane following incubation at lower temperature (26-30  degrees C) (Fig.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	237	 Unlike F508 CFTR, the misprocessing of 19 CFTR is temperature-insensitive: the protein remained in the core-glycosylated state in intracellular organelles even at 26  degrees C.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	238	 The F508 CFTR proteins, once at the plasma membrane, give rise to functional Cl channels similar to those of wild-type CFTR in terms of open probability (26) and conductance state(24, 26) .
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	239	A cardiac-specific isoform of CFTR lacks 30 amino acids in the intracellular loop between transmembrane segments II and III.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	240	 It is caused by alternative splicing of exon 5 of the CFTR mRNA(27) .
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	241	 Cardiac CFTR functions as a cAMP-dependent protein kinase-regulated Cl channel with conduction properties similar to those of epithelial CFTR(9, 28) .
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	242	 However, when expressed in HeLa cells, human CFTR lacking exon 5 failed to generate a cAMP-mediated chloride transport by the SPQ assay, apparently due to defective intracellular processing(29) .
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	243	 The strategy applied here to the study of CFTR channel function can be used to study even misprocessed or mislocalized channels and therefore ought to be applicable to the study of the effects of deleting exon 5 on CFTR channel function as well.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	244	The 19 amino acids deleted in 19 CFTR span a major part of the intracellular loop joining transmembrane segments IV and V.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	245	 This segment is highly hydrophilic, with about one-third of the residues being charged (two lysines and four glutamates).
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	246	 Several factors could account for the subconductance state associated with the 19 CFTR channel.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	247	One possibility is that retention of the 19 CFTR protein in intracellular membranes alters the function of the Cl channel.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	248	 Maturation of CFTR from the endoplasmic reticulum through the Golgi apparatus to the plasma membrane involves several processing and post-translational modifications (e.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	249	 The endoplasmic reticulum membrane contains other proteins, including various types of chaperons, that could interact with CFTR and alter the function of the Cl channel.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	250	 However, the gating kinetics and open probability of the 19 CFTR channel in the intracellular membrane are similar to those of the wild-type CFTR channel in the plasma membrane, so the deletion of these 19 amino acids did not alter the essential function of the CFTR Cl channel.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	251	 Moreover, the wild-type CFTR channel occasionally enters the O2 subconductance state characteristic of the 19 CFTR channel.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	252	 These observations suggest that the subconductance state associated with the 19 CFTR Cl channel is probably an intrinsic property of the CFTR protein, but the deletion affects CFTR in such a way as to favor the O2 conductance state.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	253	A second possibility is that this loop interacts with other domains (nucleotide-binding folds, the regulatory domain, and other intracellular loops) in CFTR or with other cellular proteins that are involved in the conductance state transition.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	254	 Deletion of part of this loop might then affect the channel structure allosterically by changing these inter- or intramolecular interactions and thus induce a quasi-stable open configuration in addition to the full open state.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	255	 Understanding the distribution of subconductance states associated with the single Cl channel should provide valuable information about structure-function relationships in the CFTR Cl channel.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	256	The approach reported here allows functional characterization of CFTR in any intracellular membranes besides the endoplasmic reticulum membrane(25) .
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	257	 By preparing vesicles from intracellular membranes separated from the plasma membrane, in principle, one can study any processing mutant in the lipid bilayer system.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	258	 Further experiments are necessary to test the role of specific amino acids of the intracellular loops (e.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	259	 positively and negatively charged and hydrophobic amino acids) in the regulation of the conductance state of the CFTR Cl channel.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	260	*This work was supported by a research development program grant from the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation and by Grants P30 DK27651 and RO1HL/DK49003 from the National Institutes of Health.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	261	 The costs of publication of this article were defrayed in part by the payment of page charges.

0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	263	 Section 1734 solely to indicate this fact.

0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	267	()The abbreviations used are: CFTR, cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator; pS, picosiemens; SPQ, 6-methoxyl-N-(3-sulfopropyl) quinolinium.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	268	 Perez for help in the SPQ assay and graphics, Drs.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	269	 Zhao for help in membrane preparations, and Y.

0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	286	 (1989) Nature 339, 597-603 [CrossRef][Medline] [Order article via Infotrieve] Drumm, M.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	287	 (1991) Science 254, 1797-1799 [Medline] [Order article via Infotrieve] Chao, A.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	288	 56, 1071-1081 [Abstract] Gunderson, K.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	289	 269, 19349-19353 [Abstract/Free Full Text] Ma, J.
0.43596935.7499295.html.plaintext.txt	290	 67, 626-633 [Abstract] Felgner, P.
